36300063.review:
I'll be honest, after Quell and Quell Reflect I felt a little burnt out and didn't have high hopes. But this game immediately reinvigorated my interest in the series and is easly the best installment so far.

While the core gameplay remains the same, this game features a new look, from the reworked and much improved menus to the various tilesets. The amount of content included has significantly expanded. Not only are there a lot more regular levels, the developers also added 24 hidden levels. There are dozens of new mechanics which gradually introduce a diversity so far unseen in the series. Levels never feel same-y or boring due to various new blocks, bubbles, mechanics and goals.

There have been several fixes of old annoyances when it comes to menu handling and transitions. The progression is very gentle and captivating and better balanced than either predecessor. The sound effects are great. The keyboard handling is as solid as ever. I've never had any kind of technical problems.

The game also introduces a melancholic storyline told in voice-over for the first time. I didn't much care for it and I feel it didn't add anything to the game. It just felt out of place and shoe-horned in. The initial load time including splash and title screens is very long for such a simple puzzle game and started to annoy me over time, but that's pretty much the only downside I can come up with.

If you want to buy only one Quell game, make it this. I do recommend picking up the trilogy collection, but there is no denying that Memento is the pinnacle. It has the most content, is the most visually appealing and stylish, is better balanced, more diverse and over-all the most enjoyable game of the series so far. This is an easy recommendation at full price for any puzzle fan.

36290118.review:
Early game:  Ma, I got this in the bag!!  No sweat!

Mid-game: started to hyperventilate (-.-")

Late-game: [url=http://cdn3.collective-evolution.com/assets/uploads/2015/12/frustrating-hair-pulling.jpg]pulling hair out[/url]

Finish: I... I... did it?! [url=http://thedaoofdragonball.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/03/goku-ssj-beat-up.jpg]Goku exhausted[/url]


Easily one of the best puzzles I've played in many years.  Good art & soothing music.  I'm hooked on this game series. 10/10

35876075.review:
Unlike the first two "Quell" games ("Quell" and "Quell Reflect"), I'm going to not recommend "Quell Memento."  Like them, the game is beautifully done.  Unfortunately, the developer continued the trend of adding more and more to the game and ended up over-complexifying it.  As Scotty said in "The Search for Spock:"

"The more they overthink the plumbing, the easier it is to stop up the drain."

And that's what happened here.  "Quell" was mostly fine with just a bit that was too complex (the green dots).  "Quell Reflect" added a few more things and made many of the puzzles too complex.  I considered it borderline OK.  With "Quell Memento," the developer added many more behaviors.  Some are fine, but a few of them just gum up the works.  If he had just left the puzzles as interesting and pleasing, I'd have been happy.  But, when a good percentage of them lead to hair-pulling and need walk-throughs to complete them, it's just not fun any more.  So, sadly, unless you're really, really good at complex puzzles, I've got to not recommend it.

30262066.review:
[h1]让你在我这翻东西，对你是不公平的。当你还年轻的时候，你急着翻开每一块石头。但你必须要花时间，准备好知道石头下面会有什么。[/h1]

在ios平台已经全成就达成了，看见steam上打折便又重温了一下。作为智力游戏来说当然棒棒哒，不过最吸引我的果然还是这个系列的BGM！！！现在已经作为一个歌单循环不能停~三部中这一部是感触最深的，那些老人的内心独白实在很触动人心，有点像Nihilumbra的感觉吧~

--------分割线---------
水滴系列全成就达成~
一个捷径是：如果前期不太用提示的话（前期关卡基本都比较简单），那么后面关卡几乎全部都用提示都是可以的（金币溢出）。
第一部和第二部的剧情基本可以忽略不计，然而第三部的老人独白真的很触动人心，比如玫瑰的记忆简直美好得难以言喻。
如果想入手水滴系列的，果然还是建议从第三部入手，这样就不会被单纯的谜题吓到啦~

29943803.review:
Rather than just adding more puzzles that are exactly the same as the puzzles from its prequels, Quell Memento manages to add several new fun game mechanics. While fun and innovative, these mechanics are still entirely in line with the core of the previous games: moving a little ball around the screen to accomplish the level objectives. 

The attempt to add a storyline to the game fell rather flat for me, but it is easy to ignore this in favour of the great puzzles that this game has to offer.

Ne consiglio l'acquisto specialmente in sconto e in bundle con i suoi predecessori.

28534110.review:
Das Spiel ist sehr gut.

Das Spiel ist fast identisch zu seinen Vorgängern Quell (Rezension [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198063825413/recommended/344480]hier[/url]) und Quell Reflect (Rezension [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198063825413/recommended/348430]hier[/url]).

Auch hier sind die Level nicht langweilig, selbst wenn man die Vorgänger kennt. Man hat viele interessante zusätzliche Elemente, die den Rätseln neue Tiefe geben.

Die Herausforderungen der Level schwankte diesmal deutlich. Es gab (auch spätere)  Level, die binnen Sekunden lösbar waren, andererseits gab es (ab ca. der Hälfte des Spieles) Level, bei denen es schwer wurde, eine Lösung oder gar die ideale Lösung zu finden.

Etwas verändert hat man die Menüführung. Man hat sogar eine winzige Erzählung drum herum gepackt, dies es m.E. nicht gebraucht hätte. Die Level sind jetzt etwas unübersichtlicher im Menü angeordnet.

Unverändert blieb die Steuerung und das Design, beides sehr gut. Die Musik ist etwas anders, immer noch gut.

Pro & Contra:

+ Sehr schöne, simple aber unterhaltsame Spielidee
+ Viele anspruchsvolle Level
+ Undo-Funktion
+ Gutes Design

- Einige einfache Level (auch im späteren Verlauf)

Wertung: 10/10

Dieses Spiel hat mir viel Rätselspaß gegeben.

[i]Genau genommen bin ich noch nicht durch, ich hebe mir den Rest für später auf.[/i]

28363253.review:
Quell 시리즈 중 가장 발전된 형태의 퍼즐 게임이다. 기존의 게임조건에서 추가로 다양한 시도가 이루어졌다. 기본 9*4*4 = 144개의 퍼즐 + 숨겨진 퍼즐 24 + 의문의 마지막 1개의 퍼즐로 구성된다. 전체적인 난이도는 무난한 정도로 구성되어있다. 몇몇 어렵고 정적인 퍼즐들은 수면제로써의 장점도 있다. 누워서 풀다보면 어느새 잠들곤 한다. 이 버전이 Quell 시리즈 중에 가장 추천할 만하고, 퍼즐을 좋아한다면 강추한다.

개인평점 9/10

25453038.review:
my original review for quell, which also works for quell: reflect, the second game, can be read [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/dohi64/recommended/344480/]here[/url], but memento mixed things up a little. at its core it's still more of the same, but the block lighting mechanic alone adds enough variety and extra challenge and there are other new things as well. instead of 84+4 levels, now there are 144 plus 24 hidden ones, and more of a story than in the previous games, but it's still not really worth mentioning.

you can look at the trilogy as one long game cut into three parts. nothing wrong with that, it's a really enjoyable experience and if you've played the previous ones, there's no reason not to play memento as well, especially with all the new stuff. the only gripe I have is that the objectives aren't displayed at the beginning of the levels and checking what color the blocks have to be requires some extra keypresses or clicking (the goal is usually blue anyway), and you can't readily access the hidden levels you've found, only by going to the appropriate level and re-doing the unlocking process.

24453584.review: 比起前两作加了一些剧情内容，还是有点意思的。还加入了一些新的通关机制和隐藏关，比前两作要好玩不少，值得一试。

24384861.review:
[h1]"The Modern Quell of 4 Seasons"[/h1]
The Quell collection is a triplet of decent challenging puzzle games. I recommend to buy all three parts in a bundle on sale. Basically you shift orbs throught logical buildup labrinths to collect all pearls with a limit of moves. In higher levels there are added some elements like poisoned orbs, spikes or portals. You can also get stuck in infinite loops. Each level contains a hidden jewel you must find in a second playthrough. The controls are sometimes buggy viewing the game is made for touchpad but it uses mouse pointer swipe instead of arrow keys. So you can accidently do a double move.

Quell Memento is the most modern part of the series. They added a storyline through all 4 seasons. Some rub-free pictures. Fresh elements like flowering roseblocks, lightbulbs or darkness bordered areas.

Altogether 144 puzzles stacked by different topics. 12 topics x 3 blocks a 4 puzzles.

24100127.review:
[h1] Quellシリーズの外伝的作品  [/h1]

個人的にはシリーズ最高傑作だと思います。

[h1] ゲーム内容  [/h1]

他のQuellよりボリュームもあり、語りがあるなど雰囲気なども違うが、やはりBGMや雰囲気は素晴らしい、この作品だけ隠しアイテムが増えており、隠しステージなどもある、ギミックなども他のシリーズに比べるとかなり多くなっており、パズル好きには他シリーズよりも確実に楽しめるかとコインシステムも健在です、難しいステージは答え合わせで楽々プレイｗ

[h1] 個人的に思った事や感想など [/h1]

とりあえずQuellシリーズで一番お買い得かと思います。ボリュームやギミックなども他よりパワーアップしてます。

IMPORTANT: THE GAME MIGHT NOT RUN ON A 32 OR 64-BIT WINDOWS 7. IF YOUR OS IS EITHER OF THAT YOU BUY THE GAME WITH A RISK OF NOT BEING ABLE TO RUN IT AT ALL. FOR MORE INFO CLICK - [url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/344480/discussions/0/358415738208879896/]HERE.[/url]

Each Quell game adds something to the previous one. I bought all 3 and can't wait for the 4th. So far the games had a lot of levels which weren't repetitive. Really worth buying "Quell Memento" and perhaps the other 2 games if they are on sale and probably most important, if you like puzzle games. I love such ones and I love even more easy 100% games and this is one of them. Bought all 3 at 80% off which is a fair price in my opinion. "Quell Memento" has even more levels than the other 2 games and it can be really challenging but there is a guide with solutions of each level so you should be okay.

23852578.review: 不得不说这是一款很有趣的小游戏，+良好的BGM（音乐素质相当的高），各种秘密关卡，有意思的故事情节。—我非常希望提供自己能自己编写关卡，后期关卡烧脑。总之它值得你花些时间去了解他

23448443.review:
This is not only *by far* the best game in the Quell trilogy, but also one of the best puzzle games I've ever played.

For the first time in the trilogy I was actually looking into getting perfect moves for all puzzles, and in order to 100% the game I only had to get help on a dozen levels or so.

Memento has the most puzzles, the most interesting puzzles, the most 'ah AH!' moments, the most mechanics, the most diversity in using those mechanics, the most songs, the most details, I could go on and on. Since it also boasts an actual story (do what you want with it), it just feels like the first two were prototypes and this is the real game they wanted to build.

I would like to insist on the puzzle designs. Memento slowly introduces many, many new mechanics over the entire game, and never forgets to add a few tutorial puzzles, which also give you breathing room after some harsher earlier stages. But it never tries to impose these new mechanics on you -- sometimes it'll just abandon them after a few puzzles, because the game simply wants to surprise you; it doesn't try to force mechanics that don't make sense into a particular puzzle.

You can feel that the developers had a lot of fun creating the levels, and hopefully you'll have just as much fun discovering them. Take your time, enjoy the view and have a nice cuppa.

23325795.review:
《水滴解谜:反射》，解谜类游戏
通过控制水滴，用最少步数，将地图中的珍珠全部收集，并在隐藏方块中找到珠宝。

游戏自带中文，操作简单。解谜要素虽然不多，但也构成了各式的关卡。bgm也很好听。

[spoiler]点击主界面的画框还可进入隐藏关卡。[/spoiler]

游戏难度比起前作较为困难，很多关卡把之前的各种解谜要素都组合在一起。用了近七个小时才全成就。提示的次数较多，用于卡关。

总得来说，是款不错的游戏，很适合平时休闲。

22819158.review:
If you have played Quell or Quell reflect then all you need to know is 
- This game is of the same quality of the other games but longer
- There's new elements and more puzzles. The puzzles are not a copy of the old ones
- This game takes a couple of seconds to start. Something that I rarely noticed in the other games

You don't need to have played the previous games. You can start with this one. 
If possible, though, I'd recommend playing the whole collection in the proper order: Quell, Quell Reflection and Quell Memento.

--------------------------------------------------------------

- The levels are well designed with a difficulty going from easy to hard (but not too hard) levels
- No timer at all
- You can play as as little as you want and continue where you left off or go back to previous levels to complete unfinished objectives
- A few levels are hard to finish but a perfect number of moves but there's no penalty for retrying them (there's even an achievement for that!) so you can be persistent or use coins that you obtain by perfecting levels
- Finding and getting the jewel in every level gives you a different objective. There are also 24 secret levels and the clocks in it
- Good fun for the price

It's very well done too:
- Graphics, music and sound are nice and polished
- Graphic options work as the should (several fixed resolutions, full screen, windowed mode)
- Music and sounds can be muted separately
- Movement can be controlled with keyboard
- Resetting a level or going to the next one can also be done with keyboard

22810758.review: I don't think the story parts were needed but this is still the best version of the quell series. Great game!

22412822.review: Quell Memento is the third game in the trilogy and is a nice relaxing puzzle game. This installment adds even more mechanics to the gameplay, they're nice but don't always flow as nicely. Overall I still throughly enjoyed the experience. I would reccomend buying the whole Quell collection.

21989448.review:
パズルゲーム。
Quellシリーズ3作目。押すと障害物にぶつかるまで押した方向に進み続ける雨粒を動かして全てのパールを集めるパズルだ。
通常ステージ144、エンドステージ1、隠しステージ24と全169ステージとなっており、前作までの全84ステージと比べると2倍のボリュームになっている。また新しいブロックやギミックが追加され、これまでの「シリーズの集大成」といった内容になっている。あまり追加要素の無かった前作に比べると、この追加要素は嬉しい。ナレーションが流れる程度だがオマケ程度に演出面も強化されている。新しいギミックが追加されているが前作同様に複雑なものではなく、シンプルで分かりやすいルールのために手軽にプレイできる。
このシリーズが好きな人やシンプルルールのパズルが好きならオススメのゲームだ。

21982836.review: 好游戏，不多说，通关了之后看了下不知道怎么就排名全球第三了。就是为了加一个赞的。

21828155.review:
[i][h1]很久以前，我被一束玫瑰划破了拇指，但她却牵着我的手一起走过，今生今世的每一天都是如此......[/h1][/i]

简单的游戏规则，设计精妙的关卡。通过对游戏细节的观察，你能够发现，每一关的标题和每一处细节都是房间主人的记忆碎片，一个孤独的老人的回忆。

著名作曲家Steven Cravis打造了这款游戏的音乐，跳动的音符如水滴般静谧无声。

它不仅仅只是一部解密游戏，而是一幅来自一位有着无数故事的老人的记忆拼图。一位孤独的老人在迟暮之年回首往事的时候，面对着枯萎的树叶、残破的房间，当你直面一去不复返的记忆，走向平静便是对整个生命的升华。

全成就通关，纪念这款曾在整个安卓平台上最令我印象深刻的游戏！

21758332.review:
非常棒的小游戏。之前是一直在iOS平台上玩的，现在看到quell系列全部折扣加上有Collection入的。

这个游戏确实容易上瘾。在每一个关卡中，你都需要尝试用最少的步数达到目标，并且探索其中隐藏的宝石和隐藏关卡，而隐藏关卡又包含了隐藏的时间碎片，这些额外物品的收集难度不亚于考虑如何完美通关。目前玩通了前面4个关卡，后面的还要慢慢打。

游戏的整体风格相当清新，背景音乐非常不错。

总体评价，解谜类游戏爱好者必须要入的一款好游戏。[spoiler] 3个加起来7块钱，买买买啊！[/spoiler]

21720482.review:
跟上作一样类型的水滴解谜游戏，延续了上作令人放松的背景原声
但是这作又加了新的元素进来，叙述者的旁白，陈破的阁楼和积满灰尘的相册，让游戏本身变成了一个回忆的故事
游戏内，添加了多颗水滴互换解谜，金色水滴，霓虹灯解谜，还有隐藏的造钟人的密室等等等，每下一关都有新的惊喜，可玩性又更上一层楼
还是觉得这是steam上性价比最高的游戏之一
玩了第三部reflect，惊觉这一部确实是最棒的一步
Like its previous work, the Quell Memento still have its relaxing OST.
However, this time the game has added new elements, such as the voiceover of the narrator, the shabby attic and dusty albums, make the game itself a story of memory.(Memento)
In game, it has mutiple droplets exchanging mode, special golden pearls, neon lamp puzzles, as well as the hidden room of the clock smith and so on... Every next level will surprise the gamers and make the game more playable.
After played the third one,REFLECT, I found this one really is the best one between three quell games.

21715464.review:
Ultimo juego de las entregas Quell,llamado memento que quiere decir recuerdo,en el se incluyen todas las mécanicas de
sus juegos anteriores e incluye otras nuevas bastantes curiosas,tiene mucho que ofrecer y diría sin miedo a equivocarme
que es el mas complejo,en cuanto a los diseño de los niveles,consta de 7 u 8 mementos que hace referencia a un objeto,
cada memento tiene cuatro series de niveles,con cuatro fases cada uno.Es recomendable en este momento debido a su
condición de oferta a 0,99 por juego y el pack con los tres a 1,99 muy ecónomico.Yo los jugue en Android no se si estan gratuitos...Saludos

21563921.review:
非常棒的解谜类小游戏。比起前作来说有很大的进步。

核心都是水滴吃珍珠，但是每个章节的玩法都又不同。
增加了许多隐藏关卡和额外的收集要素。
多了点剧情，虽然不能引人入胜，但对于一个这样的小游戏来说已经很用心了。
有中文界面和字幕。
完全支持手柄。

不足的可能就是流程有点短。

[spoiler] 虽然每关的可能性就那么几种，但有时候就是想不到，尤其是收集的宝石，一定在最不容易撞到的砖块里。[/spoiler]

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
今天无意间发现了一个隐藏成就，steam成就系统里没有，游戏内显示的。你获得以后成就数量不会变，还是显示31个。但是实际有32个。
[spoiler] 成就是‘超越极限’内容是‘在游戏规定的完美次数限制之内就完成关卡’。[/spoiler]
意外的惊喜。

21312483.review: It is everything Quell and Quell Reflect is with additional mechanics that spice up the game, allowing it to achieve a new level of nirvana. Quell Memento brings in a lot of new without diminishing your experiences with the old. The Quell Trilogy is indeed a comforting set of puzzle games that appropriately belongs in the library of any puzzle games enthusiast.

21220702.review:
If you like puzzle games, you will love Quell Memento.  A various number of newly introduced game-mechanics were sensefully used to design mind-provoking puzzles, that go into deep without being unfair. The presentation of the game is more than professional. No time limits, so you can chillout on the sounds and let your mind do the work. Excellent ! 

Sometimes the music is a little bit too melancholic where it should be more relaxing. The music in the bonus-levels, that are entered over the bronze rings, is like tense drum-tremor - i dont like that. But beyond these two blemishes Quell Memento is an excellent puzzle game for a friendly price !

20962346.review: I would save Quell Memento for after giving Quell and Quell Reflect a try. Memento uses the same concepts of the other two games but now includes a somewhat touching story, complemented with great soundtrack. A lot of new game mechanics are introduced as well, making levels more challenging more quickly. Great series.

20335480.review:
The first Quell was simple and it was good. If I couldn't solved a level in the optimal number of moves, it was because I screwed up.

In an effort to add variety, Quell Memento adds a number of new gameplay elements. Some of them work well but many of them don't. Some just add complexity, but not in a good way. It's easy to make an puzzle game with every increasing complexity that is hard to solve. The tricky part is designing something relatively simple, yet so clever that solving it is a challenge.

Quell Memento isn't a bad game, but the first one was much better, so there was no need to make Memento. If you're desperate for some more Quell levels after completing the first two games, then Memento might be for you, otherwise I would suggest giving it a miss.

20120762.review:
Good puzzle game. It's actually quite difficult and has multiple additions from the first game.  If you played the first one and thought it was a bit to easy and are wary of getting this one, don't worry: this one has some pretty challenging puzzles in it. 

Just like the first one you collect pearls to beat the level and there's random hidden gems in blocks you'll have to smash your ball in to to get. I hate the gem thing and used a guide to get a good amount of them because I think it's stupid to have hidden stuff like that in puzzle games. I'm playing a puzzle game, not a smash my ball into every block simulator.

This game adds multiple unique ways puzzles have to be completed unlike regular quell though.
-light up all the blocks to adds certain color
-light up all the diamonds with your light rays
-a weird gold pearl that turns your ball gold and mostly screws with level completion for various reasons
-moving a red ball simultaneously with your blue ball (red balls kill)
-there's hidden levels with hidden items in some levels. They follow the same unlocking procedure as the gems, so I hate them

All in all, just ignore the gems and you've got yourself a nice little puzzle game on your hands. It's very challenging at points and if you enjoy puzzle games or blue balling then this game is easily recommended for you.

19811345.review: Great puzzle game! Very relaxing music!

18652536.review:
Décidemment, la série [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198164382571/recommended/344480][i][b]Quell[/b][/i][/url] se bonifie d'épisode en épisode ! Par rapport au volet précédent ont été intégrées dans le gameplay beaucoup de nouveautés ; la complexité et donc la difficulté allant parfois de pair. Le contenu est par ailleurs trés conséquent : bref, aucune raison d'être déçu !

[h1]Verdict : 4,5/5 - Excellent, à acheter les yeux fermés ![/h1]

18295248.review: With no doubt, it's the best of the three Quell, thanks to the diversity. But, to my opinion, it's worth playing all of them.

18056577.review: Best in the series, and about as good as puzzles games get.

17065346.review:
[h1]Quell Memento fait parti de The Quell Logic Collection[/h1]

Quell Memento cloture la trilogie Quell Collection.

Ce jeu a un design tout aussi soigné mais plus moderne que les deux autres. Si Quell me fait penser au jardin, Quell Reflect à la maison de campagne, Quell Memento correspond plus à l’appartement moderne en pleine ville.

Le but du jeu n’a pas changé. « Vous dirigez une goutte d’eau dans un tableau et vous devez ramasser toutes les perles du tableau. La contrainte, c’est de faire cela en un minimum de déplacement. » 

Vous découvrirez des nouveautés, bien évidemment, mais aussi, ce qui est nouveau, une histoire.

[url=www.graal.fr/2015/05/29/test-the-quell-logic-collection-la-version-pour-steam/]N’hésitez pas à lire toutes mes impressions sur The Quell Logic Collection.[/url]

16539785.review: An amazingly thought out puzzle game, it is like nothing I've ever seen. If you like a true challenge, where you have to do every move right, but without the pressure of time, definitely get this. Not only that but the artwork, audio, and even the storyline all go together to create what I believe should be considered a masterpiece. The Quell Series just keeps getting better and better, perhaps they will astound me yet again with a fourth ;)

15828574.review:
Quell Memento is the third game in the Quell series, and is unique in several ways. Some of the things it includes with the two previous Quell games are the amazing level of polish, and the spectacular soundtrack. This game also retains the challenging puzzle aspect of the other games, but manages to add so much new content that it feels like a whole new world.

In Quell Reflect several new mechanics had been added over the original game, Quell Memento takes those mechanics and multiplies them three-fold. Adding in whole new puzzle types, and at least a half dozen new mechanics, this game is a whole new experience on the old puzzle game we’ve all grown to love.

It just takes to the second shelf before you start seeing some of the major new mechanics (Illumination), and it does not take long until you start seeing why these can be so challenging!

Another aspect new to Quell Memento, and one of its strongest components is that the game has added a sort of storyline to it. For the first time in the series the game has a voice over that talks as you reach new stages. This story helps put the entire Quell series into perspective, and gives the game a life of its own. When I first played Quell Memento I was truly touched when I reached the end.

The Quell series is truly spectacular, and I cannot recommend these games enough, Quell Memento is the final installment in the series, and if you’ve played either of the others, you owe it to yourself to pick this game up today.
